vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy_bonus.withdrawReward (reentrancy_bonus.sol#8-13) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- (success) = recipient.call.value(amountToWithdraw)() (reentrancy_bonus.sol#11)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in Reentrancy_bonus.getFirstWithdrawalBonus (reentrancy_bonus.sol#15-22):
	External calls:
	- withdrawReward(recipient) (reentrancy_bonus.sol#20)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- claimedBonus (reentrancy_bonus.sol#21)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in reentrancy_bonus.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.0 (reentrancy_bonus.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Reentrancy_bonus.withdrawReward (reentrancy_bonus.sol#8-13):
	-(success) = recipient.call.value(amountToWithdraw)() reentrancy_bonus.sol#11

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
unused-state
vulnerability_findings.message: Reentrancy_bonus.userBalances (reentrancy_bonus.sol#4) is never used in Reentrancy_bonus
